byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Ferguson, and Shaila Dewan and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Mitch Smith and Jack Healy contributed reporting from Ferguson.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON, SHAILA DEWAN and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Ferguson, Mo, police conduct intense manhunt after two police officers are shot and wounded at protest; no arrests have been made and police do not yet have any suspects; city returns to relative calm following chaotic day, with all sides condemning action and some protesters holding prayer vigil.
lead_paragraph: The shooting, described as “really an ambush” by Chief Jon Belmar of the St. Louis County Police Department, was denounced by all sides in the continuing conflict over law enforcement in Ferguson.

headline.main: Manhunt Is Underway After Police Officers Are Shot in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Manhunt Is Underway After Police Officers Are Shot in Ferguson

snippet: The shooting, described as “really an ambush” by Chief Jon Belmar of the St. Louis County Police Department, was denounced by all sides in the continuing conflict over law enforcement in Ferguson.
